<!-- Image with unknown copyright status removed: [[Image:Counterspy.jpg|thumb|right|250px|A screenshot of CounterSpy version 1.5.]] -->
+
'''CounterSpy''' is a proprietary [[spyware]] removal program for [[Microsoft Windows]] software developed by [[Sunbelt Software]]. It scans a [[Personal computer|PC]] for spyware, examining files on the [[hard drive]], objects in memory, the [[Windows registry]] and [[HTTP cookies|cookies]] and it has a capability called DNR (Do Not Resuscitate) that, according to Sunbelt, improves the chances of killing off resuscitators.<ref>[http://www.pcworld.com/reviews/article/0,aid,121411,pg,1,00.asp Spyware Stoppers Still Improving]</ref> In the past, the tool was based on and used [[GIANT AntiSpyware]]'s engine. The program is currently at version 2.5. Sunbelt Software released version 2, which includes a revamped interface and smaller memory footprint.<ref>[http://www.sunbelt-software.com/Home-Home-Office/Anti-Spyware/Questions/#3 CounterSpy V2 Questions]</ref>
'''CounterSpy''' is a proprietary [[spyware]] removal program for [[Microsoft Windows]] software developed by [[Sunbelt Software]]. It scans a [[Personal computer|PC]] for spyware, examining files on the [[hard drive]], objects in memory, the [[Windows registry]] and [[HTTP cookies|cookies]] and it has a capability called DNR (Do Not Resuscitate) that, according to Sunbelt, improves the chances of killing off resuscitators.<ref>[http://www.pcworld.com/reviews/article/0,aid,121411,pg,1,00.asp Spyware Stoppers Still Improving]</ref> In the past, the tool was based on and used [[GIANT AntiSpyware]]'s engine. The program is currently at version 2.5. Sunbelt Software released version 2, which includes a revamped interface and smaller memory footprint.<ref>[http://www.sunbelt-software.com/Home-Home-Office/Anti-Spyware/Questions/#3 CounterSpy V2 Questions]</ref>
